channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report X-2023111242
item.description:
Report X-2023111242

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: SPRING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Degreaser was moved into a Hazmat Tote for processing, spill neutralized. Tote moved to Hazmat Cage for processing. DescribePack: package was found with internal leak. bottle on its side allowing leak to spread. cap was off the top of the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in hazmat tote upright to contain spill/leak.

item.title: Report X-2023111190
item.description:
Report X-2023111190

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-17
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Loose Caps Led to the package leaking. A package handler noticed this. They then proceeded to notify the manager of their area, who then placed the package in a damaged hazmat tote. The package was taken to the damages area. DescribePack: Loose caps led to the package leaking. There was a loss of 2 quarts of the material. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was brought to the damaged hazmat area. This was done to separate the package and prevent damage occurring to other packages.

Report X-2023111175

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found wet near a load door, emitting a strong acid smell. DescribePack: Upon inspection, all 4 plastic bottles still appeared mostly full. An extra seal was under the plastic caps. One cap had come off and another was bent upward. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was placed into a salvage drum and moved to Hazmat cage.

Report X-2023111141

  • City: IRVING

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet on the van line and was removed from the van line and placed in a red hazmat bin with absorbent pads underneath and taken to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: Two of the six cans had loose caps. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was removed from the van line and placed in a red hazmat bin with absorbent pads underneath and taken to the hazmat cage

item.title: Report X-2023111129
item.description:
Report X-2023111129

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX BROUGHT TO HWPA, BAGGED AND PLACED IN A RED TOTE. DescribePack: BOX WAS SATURATED ON ONE SIDE AND BOTTOM, RIPPED AND CLOSURES WERE OPEN. INSIDE, BOTTLE WAS STAINED, CAP LOOSE AND SEAL LIFTED APPROXIMATLY 1/2 INCH. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: CAP WAS TIGHTENED AND BOTTLE PLACED IN A BLUE HAZMAT BAG. BAG WAS SEALED. ALL MATERIALS BAGGED AND SEALED IN A YELLOW STORAGE DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023111128
item.description:
Report X-2023111128

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: HAZMAT ADMIN WAS CALLED TO UNLOAD AREA. BOX WAS BAGGED AND SITTING UNDER THE CHUTE. BOX WAS LOADED INTO A RED TOTE AND TAKEN TO THE HWPA. DescribePack: 1 OF 6 CANS WAS LEAKING. BOX ABSORBED THE LIQUID. CAP WAS MISALIGNED AND LEAKED WHEN TILTED. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: CAP COULD NOT BE REALIGNED. ABSORBENT PADS WERE FOLDED AND PLACED AROUND CAP. ABSORBENT PAD WAS TAPED INTO PLACE AND SEALED. CAN WAS PLACED INTO AN INDUSTRIAL ZIP LOCK BAG AND SEALED.

item.title: Report X-2023111095
item.description:
Report X-2023111095

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-09
  • City: SPRING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was unloaded. Leak remained internal. Moved into hazmat tote and removed from sortation. DescribePack: no packaging failures. Plastic jug had a crack going down the side. Crack was in the seam of the plastic indicating a manufacturing defect. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in Hazmat Tote and kept in an upright position to reduce leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023110866
item.description:
Report X-2023110866

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-09
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came down chute wet near a load door. DescribePack: Upon inspection, packing paper was wet inside box. A strong smell was detected. Shipping label was faded. One cap could be tightened with a small twist and multiple rectangle cans were disfigured at the bottom. No active leakage was found and no can felt completely empty. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was set aside and wrapped in a bag. Leakage was not spreading. Box was placed in a salvage drum and moved to Hazmat processing area.

item.title: Report X-2023110785
item.description:
Report X-2023110785

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in QA damage area, in a torn box contained in a thick plastic bag. DescribePack: 3 bottles of Zep Acidic Toilet bowl cleaner were found inside of the box. 4 were indicated on label. Of the 3 bottles present, none were actively leaking but green stains were seen on the surface. Minor stains were also seen on the torn portion of the box. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was secured in a thick bag when found. No active leakage was observed.

item.description:
Report X-2023110745

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: After the package was processed, and sent to its appropriate door, mishandling led to the package leaking. The package was placed in a damaged hazmat tote. I was then notified of the package being damaged. I brought the package to the damaged hazmat cage. DescribePack: One of the aluminum cans has been punctured on the bottom corner. This appears, to be the source of the damage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was segregated, from other packages to prevent damage from spreading.

item.description:
Report X-2023110725

  • City: MESQUITE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found to be leaking on load side 1 by door 106. QA hazmat was called. Upon arrival the package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were placed down to prevent injury. DescribePack: The package was punctured on the bottom of the drum/jerrican. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed into a clear hazmat bag in a red hazmat tote and returned to the hazmat cage. Spill pads were placed down to prevent injury.

item.title: Report X-2023110930
item.description:
Report X-2023110930

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler seemingly mishandled the package. As when it was processed there was no damage. The package handler notified their manager who then put the Package in a damage hazmat tote and took the package to damages as opposed, to the damaged hazmat processing area. DescribePack: The package was overpacked by the shipper however, the can that contains the package contents has been dented. The body of the can opposite the closure is heavily dented, this is where it appears, the package was leaking from. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was segregated from other packages. This was done, to prevent other packages from getting damaged.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler noticed package is leaking, notified Ops Mngr and then it was bagged. A tugger took the package to QA and placed inside tote box, waiting to be taken to hazmat for proper process. DescribePack: One of the lids on a bottle of RapicidePA Part B twisted open and is leaking liquid content. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The leaking package was bagged and placed inside tote box.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet coming down a chute by a load door. DescribePack: Upon inspection, one of the four bottles inside of the package had a loose cap and was slightly less full than the others. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was placed in a thick bag inside of a drum and moved to Hazmat processing area.

item.title: Report X-2023110726
item.description:
Report X-2023110726

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was processed and sent to the trailer it was supposed to go to without incident however, after it had made it to the right door something occurred which led to the package leaking due to a loose cap. The manager was notified and, they then placed the package in a damage tote. I was then notified about damaged hazmat's and went to grab them. I then brought the packages to the damage Hazmat cage. DescribePack: Loose caps led to the package leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was separated from other packages. This was done to prevent damage from spreading to other packages.

item.title: Report X-2023110720
item.description:
Report X-2023110720

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler set the package under the rollers on the side, rather than following through with the orientation arrows. the manager noticed this and proceeded to set the hazmat outside of the damaged hazmat cage. DescribePack: Loose caps, led to package leakage. this resulted in a damage report needing to be placed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the package was segregated, to prevent damage to other packages.

item.title: Report X-2023110715
item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At the time this package was processed it was undamaged. A Package handler noticed the package was leaking prior to loading it and, they notified their manager who set the package outside of the damaged hazmat cage. DescribePack: One of the caps on the bottles was unscrewed, which led to the package leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was segregated, to prevent damage occurring to other packages.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler noticed that the package was leaking. They then proceeded to notify their manager who then brought the package to the damaged hazmat cage. DescribePack: It appears as though inadequate preparation for shipping led to the package getting punctured, on the bottom of one of the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was segregated, from other packages. this was done to prevent further damage.

The shipment has been placed on hold pending an investigation with the shipper and this report has been filed.

  • Description: On 10/27/2023 at approximately 0830, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 393838 at the ramp facility in Fort Worth, reporting a package spill. The shipment consisted of 3 fiberboard boxes, each containing seat belt pretensioners. The shipment ending -6766 was found damaged, resulting in spillage. The package is being held for pick-up by the reciepient.

item.title: Report I-2023110023
item.description:
Report I-2023110023

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SLAY TRANSPORTATION CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. A leak was discovered coming from tank trailer, while trailer was parked at the Slay Transportation Co, Inc. facility. E3 Environmental was dispatched to assess and perform cleanup and tank trailer transfer. E3 Environmental hand shoveled the impacted gravel beneath the tank trailer and placed a bucket to contain further release. E3 Environmental proceeded to transfer the product from compromised tanker into a recovery tanker provided by Slay Transportation Co., Inc. Product was transferred without further incident. One 55-gallon drum of contaminated gravel and cleanup debris was generated. There was no impact or threat to enter state waters. There were no injuries or exposures reported.
